    • Method Detail

      • showMessage

        public void showMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Helper function for displaying messages as pop-ups.
        Parameters:
        message - the text to be displayed on the pop-up.

      • getStatus

        public java.lang.String getStatus()
        This function gets the status of the tile, checking if the crop is harvestable, growing, and withered.
        Returns:
        report a string that tells the user on what he or she can do with the tile/crop.

      • checkRocked

        public boolean checkRocked()
        Checks if the tile is rocked or not.
        Returns:
        a boolean if the tile is rocked.

      • checkPlowed

        public boolean checkPlowed()
        Checks if the tile is plowed and plantable or not.
        Returns:
        true if plowed; false if not.

      • checkPlanted

        public boolean checkPlanted()
        Checks if the tile has a plant/crop in it.
        Returns:
        a boolean if the tile has a crop or not.

      • checkEmpty

        public boolean checkEmpty()
        Checks if the tile is empty (contains a plant or a rock).
        Returns:
        false if the tile contains either a plant or a rock otherwise true.

      • checkCrop

        public java.lang.String checkCrop()
        Checks what the crop's name is.
        Returns:
        the name of the crop.

      • getCrop

        public Crop getCrop()
        Checks if the tile has a crop or not. If it doesn't it will return null. If it does it will return the crop.
        Returns:
        the crop or null if there's none.

      • setRock

        public void setRock()
        Sets the tile to rocked if triggered.

      • removeRock

        public boolean removeRock()
        Removes the rock if the tile is rocked.
        Returns:
        a boolean if the tile's rock was successfully removed

      • setPlowed

        public boolean setPlowed()
        This function plows the tile. It also checks if the tile is already plowed or has a plant in it. It will return false if plowed or has a plant; true if it's not.
        Returns:
        true if not plowed or planted. False otherwise.

      • getWithered

        public boolean getWithered()
        Checks if the tile has a withered crop.
        Returns:
        true if tile has a withered crop, false if it doesn't.

      • plantCrop

        public boolean plantCrop(Crop crop,
                         MyFarm farm)
        Plants a crop inside the tile. It also prints the status of the crop.
        Parameters:
        crop - the crop will become the crop inside the tile
        Returns:
        a boolean if the planting was successful.

      • removeWithered

        public boolean removeWithered(int currentDay)
        removes the withered crop. It also checks the status of the crop whether it's withered or not.
        Parameters:
        currentDay - used to get the status of the crop inside the tile
        Returns:
        a boolean whether removing the withered crop was successful or not

      • harvest

        public void harvest(int currentDay)
        The harvest function harvests the crop inside the tile. It also sets the crop back to null and hasCrop to false.

      • cropWithered

        public void cropWithered()
        Sets the tile's withered status to true.

      • getTileByXY

        public Tile getTileByXY(int x,
                        int y)
        Gets the tile based on the coordinates given.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-axis coordinate of the tile.
        y - the y-axis coordinate of the tile.
        Returns:
        the tile if it matchs the coordinates.

      • printTileInfo

        public void printTileInfo(int currentDay)
        Prints relevant information about the tile in the terminal if triggered.
        Parameters:
        currentDay - the current day in the game loop.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                 GamePanel gamePanel)
        Displays the tile's image based on its contents.
        Parameters:
        g2 - the graphics object.
        gamePanel - the area where the farm, crops, and charcter are displayed.
